title: UPDATE | 2 children, 2 adults shot in Cleveland
content:
CLEVELAND -- Police say two children and two adults were shot when gunfire erupted in Cleveland late Monday.
Police originally said two children and one adult were shot. On Tuesday morning, police said a fourth victim reported to MetroHealth.
Police say two boys -- ages 9 and 14 -- were each shot in the leg. Two 34-year-old women were shot in the back.
All four were taken to MetroHealth with injuries that are not believed to be life-threatening.
Authorities say the victims were found when officers responded to shots fired in the 1400 block of W. 107 Street.
Investigators say a woman had been arguing with her boyfriend outside the residence when a man inside the home came out with a gun and started shooting.
Police say additional investigation reveals the suspect was firing at a second suspect. Both suspects fled the area and police recovered five casings from two different weapons.
The suspect's name has not been released, but charges are expected.
No additional information was immediately available.
